item.title: CLEAR Sailing for 4G Wireless
item.description: You’re hearing a lot about 4G wireless technology, but did you know that CLEAR is already rolling out its 4G WiMAX network? If you happen to live in an area where CLEAR WiMAX is currently offered, you can experience internet speeds comparable to DSL or Cable, all without the need for physical wires. They have a range of plans to suit your needs, whether it’s for your home, mobile device, or both.

item.title: Business DSL Alternatives
What To Do If You Hate Your Internet Service
item.description: Many people express frustration about their internet speed or lack of broadband access. While high-bandwidth options might not always be suitable, there are solutions for individuals and small businesses. Broadband access is a pressing issue, so much so that the government is investing significantly to expand coverage in underserved areas. While this will eventually improve access, universal coverage like electricity or telephone service is not yet feasible. In remote areas, wireless internet is often the best option.

item.title: Advantages of a Wireless Business Continuity Plan
item.description: For businesses today, the difference between success and failure often comes down to a reliable internet connection. In the past, while important, telecom connections weren’t critical for daily operations. Now, with businesses relying on cloud-based applications and data storage, a lost connection can bring everything to a halt. While wired connections are generally dependable, they aren’t perfect. Downtime, whether due to equipment malfunctions or accidental cable cuts, can lead to significant financial setbacks.
